plotly

Hendrilalaina

2025-03-31

suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(tidyr))
suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(plotly))
suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(dplyr))

1 Introduction

We will use data from World Happiness Report. The World Happiness Report is a landmark survey of the state of global happiness.

2 Data Preparation

The data can be downloaded from (https:www.kaggle.com/unsdsn/world-happiness/)

happiness_2015 <- read.csv("../RUltimateMaterial-main/data/2015.csv") %>%
  mutate(year = 2015)
happiness_2016 <- read.csv("../RUltimateMaterial-main/data/2016.csv") %>%
  mutate(year = 2016)
happiness_2017 <- read.csv("../RUltimateMaterial-main/data/2017.csv") %>%
  mutate(year = 2017)

happiness <- happiness_2015 %>%
  bind_rows(happiness_2016) %>%
  bind_rows(happiness_2017) %>%
  select(Country, `Happiness.Score`, `Economy..GDP.per.Capita.`, `Health..Life.Expectancy.`, Freedom, year)
happiness %>% glimpse()
## Rows: 470
## Columns: 6
## $ Country                  <chr> "Switzerland", "Iceland", "Denmark", "Norway"…
## $ Happiness.Score          <dbl> 7.587, 7.561, 7.527, 7.522, 7.427, 7.406, 7.3…
## $ Economy..GDP.per.Capita. <dbl> 1.39651, 1.30232, 1.32548, 1.45900, 1.32629, …
## $ Health..Life.Expectancy. <dbl> 0.94143, 0.94784, 0.87464, 0.88521, 0.90563, …
## $ Freedom                  <dbl> 0.66557, 0.62877, 0.64938, 0.66973, 0.63297, …
## $ year                     <dbl> 2015, 2015, 2015, 2015, 2015, 2015, 2015, 201…

Rename columns

happiness_mod <- happiness %>%
  rename(happiness_score = Happiness.Score) %>%
  rename(economy_gdp = Economy..GDP.per.Capita.) %>%
  rename(health_life_exp = Health..Life.Expectancy.)

3 Visualization

3.1 Complet Plot

We create a complex visualization (5 dimensional), which has these properties: - x axis refers to GDP (an economical value) - y axis refers to life expectancy (a health value) - size refers to freedom - color refers to happiness score - text refers to country - slider refers to the year

p1 <- happiness_mod %>%
  filter(year == 2015) %>%
  plot_ly(x = ~economy_gdp,
          y = ~health_life_exp,
          size = ~Freedom^5,
          color = ~happiness_score,
          text = ~Country,
          hoverinfo = "text") %>%
  add_markers() %>%
  colorbar(title = "Happiness Score") %>%
  layout(title = "Happiness 2015",
         xaxis = list(title = "Economy (repr. by GDP)"),
         yaxis = list(title = "Healthy repr. by Life Expectancy"))
## Warning: `line.width` does not currently support multiple values.

3.2 Subplots

p2 <- happiness_mod %>%
  filter(year == 2016) %>%
  plot_ly(x = ~economy_gdp,
          y = ~health_life_exp,
          size = ~Freedom^5,
          color = ~happiness_score,
          text = ~Country,
          hoverinfo = "text") %>%
  add_markers() %>%
  colorbar(title = "Happiness Score") %>%
  layout(title = "Happiness 2015/2016",
         xaxis = list(title = "Economy (repr. by GDP)"),
         yaxis = list(title = "Healthy repr. by Life Expectancy"))
## Warning: `line.width` does not currently support multiple values.
subplot(titleX = TRUE, shareY = TRUE, p1, p2)
